data.meta_description: Getting help in East Sussex - Find local groups and services to support you, your family and friends.
data.text:
About

We bring the great outdoors to the doorstep of young people and adults with special needs and disabilities.

Understand how the countryside flows, take part in both individual and teamwork based activities to develop confidence, independence and practical skills, make new friends, understand the reasons and importance of countryside management activities and link them to where you live and beyond.

Four Seasons Activity Programme for Care Homes

We operate a ground-breaking ‘Four Seasons Activity Programme’ providing a structured weekly care home visit service (across a calendar year) for adults with profound learning and physical disabilities. This illuminating and diverse programme tracks the flows of our four seasons, using carefully themed practical activities to herald key seasonal events in our countryside.

With skilled Great Out-tours instructors providing innovation, best practise tool tutelage/guidance and supervision, care home residents work both individually and together, supporting one other on creative wild-wood craft keepsakes and nature linked projects (for care home grounds placement). All activities are specifically focused to track/build an awareness to the seasonal flows of our countryside calendar.

Four Seasons Activity Programme at our Woodside Environmental Education Centre

Through a diverse seasonally focused programme of land-based environmental activities, The Great Out-tours enrich and empower people with special needs, learning disabilities, dementia and mental health conditions, to see, interpret and understand the beauty, features and importance of our countryside. With this new found knowledge people can apply it to the context of their own lives increasing their quality of/appreciation for life.

The programme comprises a learning theme framework made up of ten land-based activity areas:

Hedgerow management and wildlife survey

Sustainable back yard project

Grow your own

Woodland management

Natural beekeeping

Livestock areas

Traditional orchard

Ponds: survey and management

Scrub management and survey

Wildflower meadows and grassland management

Charging and related information

Care Home Visit Service

Two-hour weekly price: £50 per ‘programme resident’ - based on a rolling annual contract.

(Minimum group size of 4 individuals, either all from one care home or made up of fixed referral clients from care home day centre provision).

Woodside Environmental Education Centre - Horam

Half day price (9.30am – 1.30pm): £50 per individual - based on a weekly farm attendance, as part of a one year ‘Four Seasons Activity Programme’ rolling contract engagement.

(Minimum group size of 4 individuals, either all from one organisation or made up of referrals from your/other care establishments/backgrounds).
